intro: Cheilanthes persica, commonly known as the Persian lip fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically covered in fine, hair-like structures. This plant is native to regions of Central Asia, including parts of Iran and Afghanistan. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found growing on limestone or sandstone substrates. The plant's ability to survive in harsh conditions makes it an important component of its ecosystem.
